text:
Hey all!

I'm seeing this error in the GraphiQL query builder UI.
> {
>   "message": "Cannot use 'in' operator to search for 'hasNext' in undefined",
>   "stack": "TypeError: Cannot use 'in' operator to search for 'hasNext' in undefined\n    at <https://static.hsappstatic.net/content-graphiql-ui/static-1.257/bundles/project.js:1:247603>\n    at <https://static.hsappstatic.net/content-graphiql-ui/static-1.257/bundles/project.js:1:268621>\n    at nrWrapper (<https://app.HubSpot.com/graphiql/19986643:44:26321>)"
> }
My assumption is that one of the value i'm requesting is empty on at least one of the queried objects.
Can anyone confirm that?

I've narrowed it down a bit:
The query seems to be returning an error 50% of the time and expected results the remainder

Hey <@U0281PWMGKG> I don't believe that this will be sufficient as HS would have to be told to look up the contacts before running the smart content logic. And I'm pretty sure that isn't doable.

This might be possible with a custom build replacement for the smart content. Where you could use hubl to get the contact and smart object by the ID passed via the query param. Though the contact data you can should is limited on non-password protect/membership pages/

Thanks Kevin. I hope you’re not right about that. I really need this to work! Anyway, I also passed it along to HubSpot CMS engineers to see if they knew how we could accomplish it. If they come back with an idea, I’ll be sure to update this thread.
<@U021JKWA1GB> could you share more information on the account and query you are making? Feel free to DM myself and <@U024L8W0MB6> and we can look
